headline.main: World Briefing | Europe: Russia: Chechnya Withdrawal Planned, AGain

lead_paragraph: Most Russian troops in the separatist province of Chechnya will probably be withdrawn by next spring, leaving only a rifle division and a brigade of Interior Ministry forces, the commander of Russian operations there said. Gen. Gennadi Troshev spoke to the Interfax news agency as President Vladimir V. Putin told top military officials that a return to peace in Chechnya was ''irreversible'' and that the Russian campaign there had been successful. Commanders said last winter that they were starting to remove most Russian troops from Chechnya but the withdrawal was suspended after only a relative handful had left. Michael Wines (NYT)
